meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Michael Gurshtein Rebecca Blustein Patrick Antle Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6333.

td.p: Michael Gurshtein, a thin films engineer from Thornton, Colorado
Rebecca Blustein, an academic consultant originally from Oakland, California
Patrick Antle, a graduate student in chemistry from Billerica, Massachusetts (whose 1-day cash winnings total $22,800)

tr.td: IVY LEAGUE SCHOOLS
LOOK OUT BELOW
AMERICAN FOOD
THE SPLENDID LITTLE WAR
ALSO A GIRL'S NAME
SINGERS IN SONGS

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'It\'s the oldest Ivy League school & the USA\'s oldest institution of higher learning')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: It's the oldest Ivy League school & the USA's oldest institution of higher learning

')

tr.td: Patrick
Rebecca
Michael
THE TEMPLE AT JERUSALEM
WOMEN DIRECTORS
A DAZZLING INTERNAL ORGAN SOLO
NATIONAL BOOK AWARD WINNERS
THEY GO BY THIER FIRST INITIAL
[ERRATUM: "Their" was misspelled as shown.]
A "WHEY" WITH PUNS

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
